As for being a "Universal partner"...we had called ahead to make sure that transportation to Universal was available, and they assured us it was.  Unfortunately, it was only available at very limited times (3 times in the morning, and 3 times in the evening - nothing in between, and nothing if you want to stay until the parks closed).  It did not even leave from the Comfort Suites - you had to walk to a nearby hotel.  And it was on a first come, first served basis. …

title: Clean and Cheap Option for Disney and Universal
review: I was sorry to hear that you felt we mis-represented our suites. You are correct, our rooms are not traditional, apartment-like suites. Guests are able to locate pictures of our property all over the internet on sites such as tripadvisor.com and choicehotels.com in order to make the best decision for your vacation. The shuttle service is run by Universal Studios so we are at the mercy of their schedule. I was pleased to hear you enjoyed our deluxe hot breakfast buffet in the morning and our pool area. Thank you for the review!

title: Will stay here again
review: We only stayed here for 1 quick night so we didn't get too look around very much.  What we did see was perfectly suitable for what we needed.  I found that the breakfast had a nice variety of cold & hot foods and was quite satisfactory.  It had a lot of selections and the fact that it was included in the already low rate was a nice bonus.  I don't know that I would have found it a relaxing environment if we stayed for a whole week but it was just great for a night.

title: More than adequate
review: Hotel and room were clean, room was good size (king bed), staff was friendly, rate was reasonable and (warm) breakfast was included. The hotel is close to Universal Studios and not far (by car) from restaurants (on International drive).

title: Great location for Univesal visitors
review: We appreciate the kind review of our hotel! At the Comfort Suites, we believe in delivering top notch guest service!   We look forward to serving you again!

title: Great hotel, location and staff--Great value.
review: Very nice, convenient hotel. The breakfast saved our family of five fifty dollars a day and a lot more time to spend in the parks. Close enough To parks to walk. Also enjoyed the pool, although the hot tub was way too hot. Very nice experience.

title: Thank You Comfort Suites!
review: Thank you so much for the outstanding review! Sorry to hear that the hot tub was too hot, we have since solved that issue. We look forward to serving you again!!

title: Nice budget hotel
review: We are a family of four on two week vacation which included a cruise out of Ft lauderdale and a few days in Orlando at Universal and Disney. We stayed at three differnt hotels in our travels to Florida . This was our best and least expensive stay without doubt. The property was up to date style with large value rooms. Front desk staff was the best we experienced and location was on the door step of universal studios and next to a huge outlet mall. Continental breakfast was top notch with lots of choices. If I had one negative it was the onsite laundry dryers could probably use some service. One dryer sort of worked and the other one ,I believe the element was burnt out. Great stay in Orlando.

title: The Place to stay for Universal!
review: We had a short...but one of the best vacations ever!  Easy access in case you miss the free shuttle,  free breakfast in the dining area & one of the cleanest friendliest hotels we have ever visited.  Definitely would stay here again, Especially this time of year. Visited Universal & Islands of Adventure, ate at City Walk & in Harry Potter Village...nothing to complain about here.  A little crowded, but worth the wait, even older teenagers were so tired by end of day we hardly heard any whining. All in all we will save up another 2 years & try it again!!

title: Great Universal location and Budget Friendly
review: We thank you so much for the kind review of our hotel! The team at the Comfort Suites takes pride in delivering top notch guest service along with a clean and comfortable room. We hope to see you again in the future!

title: Would stay again
review: I went with another family and would never have thought to stay here, but we did (my girlfriend booked both rooms). We usually like to splurge and stay on Univeral property or at Disney moderate/high end resorts and I was VERY concerned! However, I have to say this place was clean, spacious and a GREAT value! Free parking and free breakfast were an added bonus and it was easy to get to from Universal. From parking lot of Universal to the hotel it took maybe 8 min! I would recommend this to friends that just need a convenient,clean place to stay while visiting Universal. The room would sleep 6 comfortably where most other hotels would require 2 rooms for 6!

title: Would not Recommend
review: The room was very large, had two queens and a sofa bed. The breakfasts were terrific for a free breakfast!!  Walk to Universal was 15-20min a little further than expected.  There was a close Walgreen's to grab anything you needed.  The I Ride Trolley was right out the door and a great value to go to Sea World.  Drivers very nice.  Front desk staff could have been a little friendlier, and more helpful.  They knew nothing about the bus or trolley systems.  Thank goodness for the free internet.  Hotel lobby and food areas nice.  All in all I thought it was a great value.  I would stay again and recommend to friends. My daughter loved the towels in the bathroom. Rooms were a tinsy tiny bit dated but as long as they are clean, and nothing is worn I am happy.

title: Great place to stay
review: Old and very run down, carpet was very nasty, room was dark and oppressive with furniture pieces too big for the space leaving only small walk through area.  Bathroom was the cleanest room or we would not have stayed even though we had reservations.  In severe need of restoration.  It was close to our destination.  Room was inexpensive so it's true you do get what you pay for sometimes.

title: Never leave valuable things behind in the room or storage.
review: We stayed in this Hotel from July 16th till 19th.  Well we have a complaint about this Hotel. We left a bag for storage keeping on july 8th or so. When we returned on july 16 we found out that a lot of stuff ( brands, like gucci and guess were gone and shirts for guys was intact in the bag ). Anyway we reported it to the staff and the manager, because we dont know if our things got stolen out of our room ( during the stay 16th till 19th ). Anyway we left our information to the manager, but from the day i am writing this review WE still havent heard about the employee search from the hotel. Its already July 28th and WE still havent heard if our things are there or not. I even mailed and i havent heard from anyone ever since, so now we had to go the police, cause it seems nobody…

title: Still Holding Strong
review: Since your return home we have been in contact, and I again apologize for the confusion relating to your missing items.       If you have any of the additional information we discussed please forward to my attention.        I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Hotel was fine, but employee Michelle made our stay wonderful...
review: I had to book here overnight after staying in another hotel. I should have stayed here to begin with since this is my default Universal Studio hotel when I travel. Overall the hotel it’s still holding firm as a good clean and safe hotel to book in Orlando.   The continental breakfast is still good enough to do every morning. The staff did a good job and they are friendly most of the time. If you have a family then this hotel will meet your needs quite well. It has room for 5 people and you won’t find any surprises as far as cleanliness.   Location wise this hotel it is still very good for Universal Studios. There are plenty of restaurants around where you won’t have to walk or drive very far.

title: Clean, convenient and comfy!
review: Our goal is to stay consistent on cleanliness and service!      Thank you for your comments!

title: We'll go anytime !
review: Every year I book a group of 15 - 30 people including children and I try to find different places that will accommodate the group and the children.  I took my group to this hotel in the summer of 2009 and fell in love with the hotel, breakfast, and the location.  I took a second group there this summer and my expectations were not let down.  Not only that, Michelle was available to answer any and all questions that I had from the group.  I am sure that we drove her crazy, but with every question, she answered with a smile.    The location was perfect for us since we were going to Universal and Sea World.  We walked to Universal and caught the trolley to Sea World and to do some sightseeing on International Drive.   It is also within walking distance to great restaurants. I have…

title: Stop researching, book this hotel!
review: My 21 year-old son and I arrived in Orlando at about 10:00 AM. The nice lady at the desk allowed us to check in early. I asked for a room on the first floor so I could duck out for a smoke without taking the elevator. She gave me a room right by an exit. A clean, good sized room, very pleasant and helpful staff and free coffee all day long! An easy one mile walk to Universal. Good price. Book it!

title: Loved this hotel!
review: Thank you so much for your review. We greatly value your opinion and strive to make the best guest experiences possible. We look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Joy Chaillou-Moberly

title: Great Hotel for A Great Price
review: We stayed in this hotel with our children and my husbands parents.  I have no complaints, it was clean, the breakfast was good, and the staff was friendly!   Would stay here again!

title: Great stay in a great hotel!
review: Thank you for your response. We are so glad you enjoyed our hotel. We look forward to wowing you again in the future.

title: Average at best
review: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice and had a great experience both times. It's very close to Universal Studios; we walked to and from the parks on one trip. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was fresh and had a good selection.   The only problem we ever had was with the housekeeping staff making a lot of noise early in the morning. I addressed this issue on the comment card in the room and I also sent an e-mail to the hotel about it when we returned home. I never got a reply. This is why I gave them a low rating for service.  *We stayed here in May 2008 for one night and in March 2009 for four nights.

title: Comfortable but Moldy
review: Moldy smell in room but not too bad. But a rule of thumb is that if you can smell it, then the mold is absolutely there and yes, it is VERY DANGEROUS. Just look up mycotoxicosis.  Internet Works  Good Breakfast w/ Hot Items  Interior Corridors  MUCH better than the Comfort Suites Orlando South on Turkey Lake Road. These are NOT the same hotel!   Dirty Boxspring Cover-saw hair and crumbs when checking for bed bugs, although I did not see any bed bugs.  Staff not very friendly.  I have stayed in better places and have stayed in worse places. This is average. I probably would not recommend. Not because it is awful but because if you did your research you probably could find something without mold. Or maybe not. Who knows. This IS humid Florida after all...

title: Excellent hotel with excellent value
review: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  I was disappointed to hear of the difficulties you experienced.  Please accept my sincere apologies for these shortcomings.  I have forwarded a copy of your comments to the responsible department managers, and assure you steps are being taken to alleviate such inconveniences in the future.  We strive to provide a comfortable and enjoyable experience for each of our guests, anticipating the needs and fulfilling them on every occasion. It is through feed back such as yours that we are able to fine-tune our operation to better serve our guests. I trust you will find future visits to the Comfort Suites much more accommodating.  Again, I greatly appreciate your bringing the issues to my attention. If I can be of further assistance, please do not hesitate to call me.   Sincerely,  Joy Chaillou-Moberly

title: Great Hotel at a Great Price!
review: Checked this hotel with trip advisor before booking and all the good things said about it in previous reviews are true. The twin Queen bedded room had excellent facilities with sofa, table, fridge, microwave, kettle, iron, free internet access all included. The whole place was very clean and pool and gym well maintained, accessible, and free. Staff were friendly, choice at breakfast was better than anything I have previously experienced in the USA at this price with hot and cold menu and 24hr supply of coffee. This is the best value hotel experience I have ever seen - wife and 10 year old son completely happy (and that is not easy to achieve believe me). Would definitely use again.

title: excellent location, great value Hotel
review: My wife and I spent a week at the hotel. Because we are Choice Priveleges members we received a room upgrade. The room was spacious and comfortable. Our clock radio was not working properly and I asked about it at the desk. They told me they would replace and when we returned that evening it had been replaced. The free breakfast was good and there were changes in the menu from day to day. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly --- both staff and guests. We had a wonderful experience here.

title: Great Value
review: only 1 mile from the pedestrian entrance at Universal although i am not sure how safe it would be to walk as there are no causeways. Front desk staff quite serious. rooms large and clean. Breakfast excellent selection. Nice Gym and pool with free towels. Can't fault for the price. Would definitely stay again

title: Decent 3-star hotel
review: This is a true value for money hotel. The room rate included breakfast and internet access. The hotel was clean and well-maintained. Found a great rate at a website. The staff was courteous. Overall, a very good experience.

title: Great Hotel for Price and Location
review: The hotel was great. Loved the pool and the fitness room. Nice breakfast buffet, but think it should end a little later than 10 am. Wish the hotel had more shuttles to Universal. If you don't mind walking to Universal, it was a great location. The other guests of the hotel were nice as well! Met many nice people at the pool. I would stay here again.

title: If you have children, be wary
review: First let me say that the location is awesome for Universal. However, we stayed at this hotel with our 8 year old son and he left behind a special toy. When we called, the front desk "manager" was not helpful in any way and was sarcastic. I was told that she was not able to check the room. I asked if she would simply call the room (it was already booked) and explain the situation, and after some coaxing she finally did. She then told me that she would call me the next day after having someone check. That was three days ago and I have not heard from her since. It is not like it was an adult who left behind something, this is a child and the lack of apathy on the front desks part made a great vacation become a real disappointment. No matter the value, I would not stay here again.…

title: Great hotel for a great price!
review: The purpose of this is to convey to you and your family our sincere apologies for the circumstances you encountered with regards to contacting the hotel upon your return home. We value our guest and strive to ensure that our customer service exceeds our guest expectations.   As the General Manager of the hotel, I certainly understand your frustration. I myself travel with small children and would hope that if my child had left behind a favorite toy, that the staff would understand the urgency to resolve the issue.    If you have a moment, please contact me direct in order for me to personally apologize, as well as discuss the details. Your comments and suggestions are important to us.  Respectfully, Jan Stanek General Manager

title: Best Universal Value
review: 3 of us stayed there for a week in the beginning of June for a Universal Studios vacation. The room was clean and nice and the free shuttle to Universal was a great plus. So close to Universal, we probably could have walked if we needed to. The room was very spacious and a fun place to relax. Only problems we had were: the 1 button on the microwave was stuck down, so it kept beeping and we had to unplug it when we weren't using it, and one day all our room keys stopped working and the lady at the desk said it happened to alot of people that day. Also, the washer and dryer are nice, but the dryer didn't dry very well. We had to to dry everything twice. The laundry is in the 3rd floor, so if you plan to use it, request a room on the 3rd floor. Cocoa Beach is only about an hour…

title: Clean & quiet
review: This place had everything I like in a hotel - clean, quiet, great location and a decent price. When I was checking in I was a little scared I had made the wrong choice because a bus pulled in with a large tour group of teenagers. The front desk must have seen the look of horror because she told me we were on the 4th floor & the kids were on the 2nd. Never had a chance to use the pool because it rained so much. The interior and exterior was very clean. The morning breakfast was well maintained but there was no way to get close to using the waffle maker. Very close to I4 & Universal is at the beginning of the road. If you plan on using the shuttles to Universal & Sea World they don't run more than twice a day and the stop is at one of the other nearby hotels.

title: This was a very comfortable hotel.
review: The hotel had very comfortable beds and was very quiet.   The breakfast was also pretty good.   The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom.   It was pretty small and there wasn't a separate vanity area so it was difficult when 4 people had to get ready.  Otherwise, price and comfort were good.

title: Great!
review: We were going to Universal for a concert and decided at the last minute to get a hotel.  They were very helpful.  We wanted to check in early but our room was not ready but they offered to tell the maids to clean our room next so we could get in it as soon as possible.       The room was exceptional.  It had a refrigerator and microwave.  The shower head was decent (I know that's one of the things I look for in a hotel).  The beds were really comfortable in my opinion.  The only 2 things that I saw as inconvenient was that there were not enough plugs by the bed to plug in a cell phone charger and there were not enough tables in the breakfast area.  The breakfast was good too.      We took a cab ride over the park a few times and the most in ever cost was 10.00 because the driver…

title: Comfort Suites - Loved our Stay
review: I stayed at the Comfort Suites from Jan16-19/09 with my husband and young son. We liked the large rooms with 2 queen beds and sitting area with sofa bed. It gave my son the extra space to play in. The bathrooms were massive with both a shower and bathtub/shower. At night we were not disturbed by any noise from the hallway or next-door neighbors. The continental breakfast was ok, good to have before going to Universal for the day. TGI Fridays is about a 5 minute walk away. It was nice to have the business centre where I was able to email a quck hello back home. Staff service was great. One day we returned from shopping to find the toilet was clogged. One quick call to the front desk and someone came upstairs to fix the toilet. Would definately stay there again.

title: Excellent hotel, great location
review: This hotel was well worth the stay. We travelled for a winter vacation with 2 teenage girls and have no complaints about the facility. The free breakfast every morning was convenient and had lots of selections. The room had 2 double beds plus a pull out couch so lots of room to spread out. Very comfortable beds, microwave and fridge. Pool and hot tub were fun and relaxing after a long day at the theme parks. We were very close to Universal Studio's 2 parks. We paid the $12 for parking at Universal but there is a free shuttle bus to catch right next door at the Holday inn, times are limited. The price of the hotel was cheaper than others in the area and had more room and conveniences.  Highly recommended.

title: Great location and price; Totally recommend!
review: The value you get at this hotel was fabulous. Out room with 2 dbl beds and a pull out couch were spacious enough to accomodate 3 adults and 1 child. Breakfast was good every morning, and the staff was very pleasant. We had no complaints whatsoever.  The location is extremely close to the Universal parks, and about 20 min. from WDW. There are enough shops and restaurants around the hotel area without being overly busy and crowded.

title: better than i expected!!!
review: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of October...we had a wonderful time. check in was swift..and to our surprise the room was much bigger then we had expected. It had plenty of space for our 2 kids to spread out and play!  The free breakfasts were good too..not to everyones liking everyday..but the bread and pastries were fresh eachday and my son enjoyed making his own waffles. Hotel is very close to Universal which was great as we had a 3 day pass..so it was a short spin eachday. The Golden Corral is closeby ..close enough to walk, as we did one night for dinner. And there was a starbucks, walgreens, burgerking and TGI Fridays close too. It was an enjoyable week in this hotel and i would stay again..on my return to florida!

title: Loved it!!
review: My family and I went (husband/2 daughters/myself) a weekend during October 08 and had the great experience to stay at this hotel. It is just a couple of minutes away from Universal Studios' entrance. The room was very clean and spacious. Breakfast was perfect. Overall the hotel was clean and very well kept (pool area, lobby, halls, elevators). The night we arrived, we got a call from Front Desk 5 minutes later from check-in, asking if everything  was OK. This has bever happened to us and it says a lot of the quality of the hotel ,management and staff. The staff is very friendly and eager to help. This is going to be THE hotel when we return to Orlando.

title: Labor weekend getaway
review: I recieved exactly what I expected for the price I paid for. The best part of all I received a $50 gas card through Expedia and the parking space and breakfast at the hotel were included. I saved a lot there. This time I was looking to spend more money at the parks, on food and on my children wishes. I have no complaints about this hotel. If this is what you are looking for, stay here. After reading many reviews from this hotel and others and where it is ranked, I sure made the right choice.

title: Great hotel close to Universal
review: We were travelling with friends, and they booked this hotel. I would normally get a cheaper room because Orlando is full of cheap places to stay, but I'm glad we spent a little bit of extra money for this place. The beds were super comfy with a nice pillow top and the comforters were heavy. The room was clean and spacious. Our friends were a little disappointed because they thought "suites" meant that the living room and bedroom area would be separate, but there is just a small wall partition to separate the areas, so it just is one large room. The breakfast was well-stocked and a good value. The hotel is very close to Universal, you could walk there in 20 minutes.

title: Cheerful, Very Cheap
review: Stayed here 3 nights for a quick visit to the theme parks. Was very cheap for a suite with microwave, fridge, two double beds and a seating area. Decor VERY tired but the suite and bathroom was clean every day. Nice pool area - but didn't use it. Very noisy pool area at night as it stays open until 11pm - so if you like it quiet get a room away from the pool. Had to change rooms after first night as my air conditioner wasn't working properly, but the room change was sorted promptly. Didn't like the look of the breakfast - so we went to International Drive (5 mins away) each day. Ideal hotel if you just want a cheap, clean room to come back to, to sleep, that is close  to I4, Universal & Sea World.

title: Tropical Storm Fay
review: Stayed a week during Tropical Storm. rooms were very clean and housekeeping did everything just as we asked. Breakfast was good every day, we went down between 7 and 8 and there was plenty of room. was able to access computer near front desk most any time. Very quiet at night. Universal 15 minutes to actual park if u ask for the shortcuts. I-ride is right in front of hotel but research the lines b4 u go as drivers don't always understand what u r doing. cab was 5-6 dollars to universal for as many as u can fit (total). we used it during the rains. straight shot to seaworld on i-ride. wendy and burger king less than 5 minute walk as is walgreens. had dinner at golden corral - not really worth the money. if u walk to crakerbarrel (nice place) keep an eye out for it as the road…

title: Clean, Safe, Comfortable
review: I was extremely  leery because of a recent stay at a nearby hotel that turned out to be a nasty dump.  But this hotel was a wonderful surprise. I had 3 teenagers with me and there was plenty of room for all. The room, bathroom, bedding and all hotel areas were very clean which is of major importance to me. It was quiet and we felt safe there. The front desk workers were pleasant. The pillows and beds were very comfortable - quite a pleasant surprise. The free breakfast was pretty good, not eggs benedict but what do you expect for free? It was fine.  When I return to Orlando I will definitely stay here. If you are going to the Universal area Parks and are just looking for an affordable, clean, safe, nearby hotel then this one is perfect. I highly recommend it.

title: The Comfort Suites Universal Studio in Orlando is a great place to stay.
review: My family of 5 stayed here from a Sunday evening through to the next Saturday morning, for a total of 6 nights.  The front desk staff was always exceptionally polite and professional, and one gentleman even loaned me his personal iPod-USB charging cable for one evening!  The breakfasts were above average, with the standard pastries, cereal, make-it-yourself waffles PLUS hot breakfast food each morning, which cycled between scrambled eggs, patty sausage, bacon, and biscuits & gravy.  There is plenty of eating space.  They seemed to keep the breakfast food out until 10:00 each morning.   The room was always in tip-top shape and very comfortable for a mom, dad and three teenage and pre-teen kids!  The hotel was quiet overnight.  No security problems that I noticed at all.

title: Great place to stay
review: We stayed here for 3 nights with our Granddaugher.. We were very pleased with our stay.  It was a great location, the rooms were set up nicely and very clean. The breakfast was good,  the staff made sure it was kept full and the area was kept clean.. The pool was nice and also clean. The staff were all very nice (although the clerk at the front desk when we first came in could have been friendlier)  When we were leaving the gentleman at the front desk was VERY nice.  I was in a sling and he did everything he could to help.   I visit the Florida often to visit with family and friends and often bring my Granddaughter to the Orlando area.  I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Beautiful Inside And Out:_)
review: Just returned home this afternoon 05/22/08 from staying at the comfort suites universal. I went with my daughter, sister and her two children and we ALL were extremely pleased with all the hotel had to offer. From the free breakfast to the free coach bus that we took with friendly drivers each morning and evening to and from universal. This was our first time at the C.S. and we did not know the area. Other wise we would have walked to and from the parks. I booked two rooms #331 & #332(mine) which  was very nice and clean. Nice furnishings, pictures on the wall, bed linens, carpets etc., and my personal favorite..... a extremely clean bathroom:_)  That was the first thing I checked for. Absolutely no complaints. The hotel is kept clean daily by the workers.  I would defitnitely…

title: Great value and very convenient
review: We stayed at the Comfort Suites for two nights when we visited Universal Studios.  It is a nice, clean and modern hotel with a lovely pool area.  It is about a 25 minute walk to Universal Studios and nicely located away from the hustle and bustle of International Drive.  It served its purpose very well for us and the breakfast was good too - would definitely recommend if you are planning a trip to Universal.

title: Great Hotel!
review: The Comfort Suites was a great place to stay in the Universal Studios area!  The location is very convenient..just down the road from the park.  My sister stayed here a few weeks ago and recommended it to us.  We were 2 families of 4 and it was just perfect!  It was very clean, the rooms were great...loved the sleeper sofa!  My oldest son(6 ft) had a bed to himself, while my younger son slept on the sofa.  The pool area was nice, nothing over the top. The beds were comfy with overstuffed comforters and lots of pillows.  Breakfast was good...loved the waffles!  The eggs were strange, but the rest of the food was great!  We would definitely stay here again!

title: Great for all
review: We were in search of a hotel worth the price near Universal when we came upon the Comfort Suites which was recommended by anoth chain nearby. Upon entering it was easy to see the hotel had a complete overhaul.The front desk staff was friendly and informative and offerd a rate of $67pn and discounted Universal tickets.The room was big 2 queens and sleeper sofa with good size bathroom. The beds were beyond comfort,great mattress nad 5 pillows 3 blankets per bed.The pool area is brick paved with hot tub.Water was very warm and they brought warm towels.Morning breakfast was eggs,meats,muffins juice,ect. it was kept well stocked and hot.The only down was the park shuttle was at the hotel next door and had inconvient times but we mad it work.I would stay again if returning to…

title: Comfort Suites Universal Studio
review: Stayed for one night last week, I have a family of 5 so we need a suite type hotel. The hotel was a littel hard to find, but once we did  it was easy to get in and out of the hotel. The hotel was very clean, front desk staff was couteous. Breakfast was very good except for the long wait for homemade waffles, could use another waffle iron. It was very easy to drive over to Universal as the hotel is on Major Boulevard and the parking garages ore right  on the same road. Would reccomend this hotel to larger families. It was also very easy to drive down to Disney are from this hotel as it is only 6-7 miles away.

title: Wow Nice Place To Stay!
review: TO MAKE THIS REVIEW QUICK AND TO THE POINT,  BE SURE TO COME STAY HERE! ITS A GREAT PLACE! VERY VERY VERY VERY CLOSE to universal and Island of adventure altho honestly i would not walk, its a long walk after being at a park all day! but took us less then 4 min to drive, straight shot to park to park the car!! the hotel is nice, clean couldnt have asked for more, especially because of the price range! we had called directly got a price of about 119 a night, plus taxes, then when i checked in i had a coupon i found in a book, and altho she couldnt honor that one she offered me a rate of only 90 a night! so that helped!! they offer breakfast, and altho not THE BEST, its warm and something for my kids to put in there tummys till we hit the parks!! the parking lot is very safe and…

title: Excellent Hotel!
review: We stayed at this propery for four nights in January.  The hotel was very clean and well kept.  The staff was all very nice.  It was close to Universal too!  I will definitely stay there again!!!

title: Nice Clean Hotel
review: This is a very nice very clean hotel located in a nice area of dining and close to Universal Studios, I am here on bussiness and am enjoying my stay, they give you a nice hot breakfast, great internet service and a great staff, you wont be disapointed.

title: Wonderful Front Desk Staff,CLOSE TO UNIVERSAL !!!!
review: Had the pleasure to visit Universal the week before Christmas.  The staff here is great..free internet in the lobby kept me in touch with my familly as I had forgot our cell phones.  The check in was fast and then off to the Park.  The hotel is only 1/2 mile from the entrance to the park so we were in the Park in no time!!  My son and I were able to be at the Park as it opened (note that the Park usally opens it's doors before the scheduled time posted---so get there early--no crowds no lines at the most popular rides)..  Back to the room in the middle of the day, for a rest then off again to the Parks and City Walk..for the Nite  Spent 3 nites/4 days...The staff was wonderful,always a smile and Hi as we came and went....the breakfast was a nice touch-could get crowded as the…

title: Nice Place, Close to Universal
review: This hotel is just off the Interstate, very close to Universal.   A plentiful breakfast in a modern & clean lobby.   No complaints, it seems Comfort Suites does a good job keeping their properties similar.

title: Great Time
review: The hotel was great!  We Kept up the Do Not Disturb sign, but whenever we needed towel, etc. the house staff were always there. The breakfast was great! Every morning, they had something different as their special. Never had a problem with seating in the breakfast area!  One hint of advise, DO NOT order from the pizza places that slide their menus under your door!  We ordered from one of them at around 7-7:15pm one night and were told 45 min. We finally called them at 8:45 to ask what was going on.  They told us that some one would be there within 10 minutes. When we got our food, the pizza was cold and we ordered cheese ravoli and chick parm and received spagetti w/ meatballs as our two dinners instead. We called to complain because it took so long to get and the order was cold…

title: Close to Universal Studios
review: Traveling with two teenage nephews, I was looking for a place close to attractions and that would give us a bit more space than just a room with a couple of beds, even though I knew we wouldn't be spending much of the day in the room.  After pricing some of the other "suites" chains, I decided on Comfort Suites for the price, for the free (therefore easy) breakfast, and for the complimentary transportation to Universal Studios.  We stayed for three nights.  The room itself was fine, with 2 double beds and a sofa bed (the young guys each had his own place to sleep).  Place was clean but not immaculate, and housekeeping didn't get to our room on the second day until around 6:00 p.m.  The shower is one in which you can set the temperature but not the pressure, and although there…

title: Very Disappointed
review: We stayed at the Comfort Suites from July 15th-20th.  We chose this hotel because of its "gold medal" standard and 0.3 mi proximity to Universal Studios/City Walk.  The hotel looked nice from the outside and the lobby was spacious and clean.  The desk staff was friendly.  When we arrived at our FIRST room, we noticed the adjoining room door wouldn't lock.  We had to force the dead-bolt to ensure privacy/safety.  Then I noticed what  looked like toe-nail clippings underneath the sofa table.  There were also sesame seeds and other debris scattered across the floor.   We were offered another room.  The SECOND room appeared in better condition until we pulled out the sofa-bed  and noticed the sagging mattress.  There were no springs on the lower right side of the bed, so, my…

title: Great stay - Vey spacious room
review: We stayed at the Comfort Suites on June 29th and 30th of 2007. We had a larger suite right next to the elevators. We thought the room was very clean, plenty of towels, and enjoyed the pool as well as the breakfast.  The only concern that we had was with our door not shutting all of they way. We found that we actually had to SLAM it shut whenever we would come and go. I mentioned it to the desk, and hopefully they took care of it. We would stay there again.

title: Bring your bug killer
review: The first room we checked into was like a visit to Animal Kingdom.  German cockroaches were on the walls of the first room we entered.  Debris was also on the couch.  We moved to another room.  A small lizard and ants were in the bathroom.  This room could've used better weather stripping and a door sweep to keep the critters out.  The water would not turn off easily in the shower.  There was not sufficient hot water for evening baths (it worked in the morning).  The appearance of the hotel is good.  The pool was nice.  The front desk staff was extremely kind.  The wireless internet had a very low signal in our room.  At 8:38 am, housekeeping knocked on the door.  The checkout time is 11 am so this was much too early to be disturbed in my opinion.  We should have put up the do…

title: nice hotel, had only one problem.
review: stayed here july 2-july 5 2007. Ending our vacation with a trip to Universal studios which is across street. (make sure to get discount tickets first) Hotel is very nice rooms are spacious. Kids loved the pool. Breakfast is great there are hot items available also (some choice hotels dont offer many hot items).  Front desk very helpful and responded quickly when we requested items.  Only issue we had was, door to room didnt slam shut. (room 315)  We went out for breakfast and returned to our door ajar. We did mention to front desk. No mention of what action they would take, left it with them. The next day same thing happened with door but we checked and pulled shut. Told couple other people on our floor and they said they had no problems with door not shutting.  Try to request…

title: close to Universal, not too bad
review: We just came back from a Universal trip & stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. Room wasn't terribly clean but staff was friendly-Omar @ front desk was great. He even walked us to our room when there was a creepy guy hanging around in the lobby. The rooms were sufficient for us as we were hardly there, Universal all-day. The breakfast was good, get down there early. We grabbed the trays in our room and brought our bfst back to our room to eat as seating was limited. Lots of families. Overall felt safe. We did use the free shuttle a couple times but the departure/return times didn't work for our group. We cabbed it @ $5/ ride, easy. Cabbies were often foreign and very friendly, good experience.

title: Comfort Suites Great Location for US
review: Positive - Comfort Suites Universal was good in that it was close (very close) to Universal Studios Florida.  The room was average, bedding was ok, breakfast was pretty good One lady put more on her days then the other worker did.  I wish that the weekend breakfast went a little later.  I felt safe and comfortable during our 4 night stay.   Negative - Noisy, noisy, NOISY!  Ok - it was loud in the halls, in the pool area, and the phone rang many times with wrong room to room calls.  Large groups - like busloads of folks in the hotel.  They were very familiar with each other so they ran, yelled, called, screamed to each other without regard to other guests.    I would be sure that there weren't groups planned during my stay before I went to this hotel again.

title: Awesome Hotel
review: We just spent 3 nights at this hotel and could not have been more pleased. First, the location was perfect for our visit to Universal Studios and Seaworld - it is located on a very quiet street less then two minutes from Universal's parking garage, you could walk it if you really wanted. Very nice, newer appearing area.  The hotel staff was extremely courteous and made every effort to make our stay comfortable. The rooms are spacious - 10' ceilings with lots of room for our family of four to move around. They were very clean with modern, up to date furnishings. Kids loved the outdoor pool which was not very busy at all during our stay. Large breakfast area with a generous breakfast offering (eggs, sausage, ham, waffles, and all the normal cereals, donuts, etc). This is the first…

title: Great Stay
review: We booked our vacation through the orlando vacation store and some how they cancelled our reservation but the staff there was very helpful in getting it all straight and because of the hassel gave us free tokens to the game room. Also you know how children are well, mine through a small temper tantrum and locked himself in the bathroom and withing minuits of calling the maintanence man was right there to unlock the door. Would defenately stay again.

title: Bring a broom and a lock!
review: This Hotel looked nice on the net.  Price seemed reasonable, but, beware. After I prepaid and checked in at Hotel, when I went to review bill price was changed to higher one.  Worse part, they didn't want to change it, but eventually did. Also, first day, noticed the room was not that clean, used kleenix behind the headboard of bed, crumbs on floor, bathroom floor could use a sweep.  I told Housekeeping, and was assurred room would be Cleaned up.  When I reentered room, with housekeeper, (and she said room was clean I thought she was kidding, bedspread thrown on couch, tissues still behind bed, papers still on floor.  I had to point and show to housekeeper and she finally picked up! Also, and most importantly, door did not stay locked! It could be pushed open!  I complained to…

title: No Problem during our stay
review: We stayed one night with two children.  The room was clean and good size.  We asked for a room close to the pool which they gave us no problem on 1st floor.  Our room was also very close to breakfast area which was very convinent to get coffee and hot water.  The pool was warm and children enjoyed it.  Very close to Universal studio.  The breakfast was adequate but was getting crowded around 8:00am.  We were very happy with our stay!

title: Comfort Inn was great!
review: Our stay at Comfort Inn was very nice. Our room on the 4th floor was clean and smelled fresh. The beds and towels were also clean, contrary to other reviews I've read. The bathroom fixtures were outdated, but worked great. The room was small, but with four adults, we managed OK. Most of our time was not spent in the room. The staff was wonderful. The breakfast was what I expected, but extremely crowded (Spring Break!). The staff did their best with this. The motel was full! The shuttle was almost always late, except for one time! And we missed it, but another bus dropped us off. We drove around the block to International Blvd. for nightly meals. And drove once to Cocoa Beach. Great vacation!

title: We Had No Problems During Our Stay!
review: My husband, 14 year old daughter & I stayed at this property from 12/31/06 to 1//5/07.  Our room was on the 4th floor - no musty  odor, good sized suite - nothing stolen.  My husband would go down to the breakfast area each morning & bring back what he could - get there early or not much to choose from - but we survived.  We did drive to Universal each day we went to the park - still cheaper than staying on site!   The last time we went to Orlando, we stayed at the Radisson in Kissimmee & had to deal with the traffic jam on I-4 to get back & forth from Universal.  So this time I wanted to stay close to Universal - good thing I read the reviews on the Days Inn - I cancelled our reservations there & booked the Comfort Suites - the area is ok as long as you have a car to drive…

title: No problems
review: Our party of 4 adults just returned from Orlando. I chose this motel based on a number of things, though I was nervous about the "mold" issue others have raised.  We took adjoining rooms. I am happy to say we had no problems at all. The rooms were large and comfortable. The fridge and micro were clean.  Enough towels.  Breakfast was ample.  Each room was $80 w/ tax (and AAA discount). Only complaint is that they would not let us check in at noon, when we arrived. The clerk insisted we wait until the official 3 o'clock check-in time. Also: the claim that the motel is a block away from Universal is ridiculous.  You must drive, walk 20 minutes or so, or take a rather infrequent shuttle.

title: Terrible is correct
review: We atyed there before and was fabulous.  This time, they need lots of work. The room had mold crawling down the walls.  IT WAS TERRIBLE

title: Had reservation, but did not stay
review: We got a very good deal on a two double bed and sofa bed suite but when we got there the room was very cramped and there was a strong musty odor.  We could not open the windows to ventilate and one member of our party had begun to have an asthma episode.  Upon going into the bathroom to unpack toiletries, we found the source of the musty odor, a very large quantity of mold growing on the walls and ceiling of the bathroom.  We immediately repacked and returned to the front desk to switch rooms.  The new room was not much better.  There was a faint musty odor and we found that there was again mold growing in the bathroom that looked as though it had been painted over at one time.  The half wall separating the two beds from the sofabed was falling apart and the carpet was damp.  We…

title: Great Value!
review: We visited this hotel June 24th-June 29th and couldn't have been happier! We got a GREAT rate of $89 a night (internet special) on the hotels website. For a suite with 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa? Unbelievable price....  The hotel was in a great location, as we were visiting Universal Studios and Sea World, it is right across the street from the entrance to Universal, and a stone's throw from I-4 with easy access to Sea World from I-4. We didn't utilize the shuttle because we wanted to control the time we spent there and they didn't have very many times that the shuttle ran. They left early and came back early. It was more convenient for us to drive ourselves. The hotel is in a very nice area too, a bunch of hotels and many restaurants around the area. TGI Friday's, Orlando…

title: Loved this Motel !
review: We had a wonderful stay at this motel.  It was clean, quiet, and the staff was most helpful when we needed them.  We enjoyed the breakfast.....nice variety .  We would recommend this motel to anyone staying in the Orlando area.  If we go back, we will definitely stay there.

title: Great  Place to Stay if Universal is your Destination
review: My family and I stayed here from May 31st to June 2nd and had a wonderful time.....No problems at all with check-in or any other services offered at the hotel.  I felt the rooms were spacious, even though we were not in there very often. The pool has a nice secluded feel to it, you are not right out in sight while swimming, which I feel is a very nice feature. Other hotels we saw had the pool right near the main road or by the main entrance. But as stated in other reviews please be aware you are defintely not close enough to Universal to walk there. The shuttle service is located at the Sleep Inn across the lot and that is the way to go if you want to save the 10 dollars parking fee. It is a great service and again we had no problems at all. When we checked out on Friday we were…

title: Enjoyable
review: I visit Orlando every year and this was one of the best hotels I have stayed at in awhile.  Upon arrival to the room found that the AC did not blow cool air and it was already 90 degrees outside.  I called the front desk and got immediate response.  Maintenance arrived within 5 minutes and fixed it.  Had freezing cold air the rest of the stay.  The breakfast was great every morning.  The regular price for the room was alittle high, but I got a great deal on it.  Found a one day special for more than half the price off.

title: A Perfect Week
review: We enjoyed staying here very much.  Great staff - took five minutes and we were in our room - 15 and on the way to Universal.  Dont' try to walk to the park, much further than half-mile.  Suttles from Sleep Inn (across the street) run 3 times to the park and 3 times returning, and they're free.  Mears Transportation did a great job getting us from the airport to the hotel and were prompt in picking us up at 5:30 a.m. for our return flight.  Get to the park early as they WILL be crowded (that means 8:00 shuttle).  Breakfast is provided, and while not a complete menu, hit the spot.   Food and drinks at Universal are EXPENSIVE!  And, after a long day at the parks, pool was perfect.  Would recommend this hotel to everyone.  Finally, use the I-ride to get around town and places to…

title: Nice hotel
review: Nice size rooms for family of four.  Pool was being repaired but could walk next door and use the Sleep Inn pool.  Close to Universal Studios, not a great shuttle schedule. Good location for dining, entertainment, etc. Would recommend.

title: Better Than Expected
review: For our family of 6 the Comfort Inn Universal worked out better than expected.  Here's a quick list of positives: Very close to Universal and with a shuttle. Inexpensive - $68/night (In November) Suite had sleeping space for our family of 6 (2 queens and a fold out couch) and the hotel allowed us to have that many in the room (many other places require a second room if you have more than 5 people).  Complementary breakfast was good, mostly cereal, bagels, fruit, cold stuff, but it was fresh, had good variety, and they had do-it-yourself waffle makers which we like.  Free breakfast saves $$ with large family.   Heated pool and jacuzzi Exercise room (a treadmill and two stairclimbers) Our room and the entire hotel was clean, staff was courteous, nothing negative in our experience.…

title: needs a management shake up
review: Arrived 4pm staff could not find my pre booked reservation from the UK. Computers then went down on front desk despite having a front desk supervisor, manager and a greetings co-ordinator it took 25 minuites to check in with surly staff who were too concerned with their own issues to bother with customers. It would have been nice to have been offered a coffee or indeed an explanation but none were forthcoming.  Rooms leave a lot to be desired. They badly need a remodel and paint job. They smelled of must the inroom humidifier was noisy. Breakfast was adequate but long wait to find somewhere to sit. poolside is most pleasant but when trying to order food in the evening i was told what they didn't have. How can you run out of bread rolls or tomatoes? Noisy room in the evening with…

title: Nice but Had Problems
review: When we first arrived we were so happy with this place. It had cathedral ceilings and was very roomy, clean, and quiet. However on our second day there houskeeping threw away our bag of food and supplies! When we spoke with the nighttime front desk man he was very snippy and told us to fill out a comment card. The next morning we spoke with the front desk lady, who was very nice. They tried to locate our bag but were unsuccessfull. Because of the missing bag they didn't charge us for one night. We were really dissapointed in this hotel. Its unfortunate that housekeeping didn't pay more attention to what they throw out because we would've loved this place. Our advice to anyone staying here is to keep all bags near the window or as far away from the kitchen area as possible.

title: nice quiet hotel
review: we stayed at this hotel from the 1st to the 15th september and were pleased with the service given .Our room was large and clean,no bugs,and contained two double beds which were really comfy also a tv,microwave and fridge.The maid came every day with fresh towels and kept our room clean.Breakfast was ok with fresh fruit ,cereal ,toast ,bagles or waffles you could make freshly yourself.At the end of a hectic day this hotel was in an ideal location to unwind,close to i drive but also in a quiet area.Just up the road and without having to cross i drive is a great eating place called perkins who do delicious steaks,there is also a restaurant called fishbones which is very popular.All in all we had a pleasant stay and would not hessitate in using this hotel again.

title: Close to Universal..
review: We stayed here for 3 nights May 15- May 18 2005. The rooms were adequate for 4 people. They were clean. Staff not all that helpful. The free breakfast was ok it included make your own waffles, bagles, muffins and a variey of pastries and cereals. We were disappointed with the free shuttle service to Universal. To catch the shuttle you had to walk across the street to another hotel. The bus was always full by the time it got there than you had to go to 2 more hotels before finally getting to Universal. So everyday you were standing on the bus packed with people. The pool was ok, the hot tub was  luke warm at best and the pool area closed at 10PM. If I were to go to Universal again I would probably look for another hotel as there were many in this same area with compariable rates.

title: Not bad
review: We stayed at this shotel for 2 nights and found it to perfectly fit our needs.   It was VERY close to Universal Studios, and in a safe area.  The room was spacious and clean, but the bedding had quite a few stains on the bedspread.  The breakfast was good (they even had waffles that you could make).  I didn't hear any noise through the walls, but I slept with the AC on.    The staff weren't especially helpful, though, and even gave incorrect information about local things.   If you want to stay somewhere close to Universal, this is an OK place.  But, there were lots of other hotels rights next to it, just as close, if you'd want a different option.

title: Very nice hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel from February 19-22, 2005. We approached our stay at this hotel with some trepidation after reading a couple scathing reviews on TripAdvisor; however, we were very pleasantly surprised by our experience there. The people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The hotel looks very nice outside and inside. We had absolutely no problem with our room. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. We appreciated having the microwave and small refrigerator. I also liked the location of the hotel off the main drag. We found it to be very quiet, even though there appeared to be lots of kids staying there. The breakfast provided each morning was good. I enjoyed the waffles. The only bad thing was that they had the worse orange juice I have ever tasted in my…

title: ....never again
review: I stayed at this inn Feb. 20 - 24, 2005... having been booked here by the Company's Travel Bureau because the hotels in which I usually stay were booked full.  NEVER AGAIN!  At checkin, I approached the two young ladies at the desk, who seemed quite "put out" that I should interrupt there "chit-chat."  There were a number of problems during my stay, one of which I'll briefly describe.  The morning after checkin, I left the room to get a cup of coffee.  Upon returning, my key would not allow me to enter.  With electronic locks, that is not too much of a surprise....however, when I went to the front desk, I once again met the clerk "with an attitude" who informed me that my credit card had been declined.  I have had the same American Express card for thirty years and have never…

title: Great Location
review: A great hotel to stay at if visiting Universal's parks. Very easy access to parks, less than a five minutes drive to the parking lots. Very clean rooms, and great breakfast choices. We stayed for four nights 6/6-6/10/04. We would stay here again.
